bug.author: ofbennett
bug.summary: Odd appearance of correlation heat map
bug.description:
Describe the bug I've produced a report from a small dataset with 4 numerical variables (and 2 other categorical ones). The correlations heat map seems to have formed rather strangely (see below). More grid lines than necessary and the top and bottom has been cut off. Not completely sure if a bug or I've done something wrong, but after some effort I haven't been able fix it. I'm viewing the report in a browser (tested on Safari and Chrome). <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11752456/73657791-ef279000-468a-11ea-85ca-3b0d1398d75d.png></denchmark-link>
To Reproduce import pandas as pd from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport
df = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/gapminderDataFiveYear.csv') profile = ProfileReport(df, title='Pandas Profiling Report') profile.to_file(output_file="report_years.html") Then open report_years.html in browser. Version information:
Python version: 3.7.6 pandas-profiling version: 2.4.0 Environment: MacOS 10.13.6, Command line, conda environment
Click to expand Version information
